intro: Dipteracanthus vindex, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy texture. The flowers bloom in late summer and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
